title: Ardent flies as buyer snaps up stake at 20pc premium
text:
Ardent Leisure Group was fast out of the gates on Tuesday morning, after a buyer paid a 20 per cent premium to snap up a 4 per cent stake in the company.

A line of 19 million shares crossed at $1.20 each just prior to the open, which was well up on the company's prior close of $1.005.

Ardent Leisure executive chairman Gary Weiss will have his bankers keeping a close eye on the share register. Jessica Hromas

It is understood George Kanaan's institutional blocks desk at UBS handled the trade.

It represented 3.96 per cent of the company's shares on issue and was worth $22.9 million at the traded price.

Fund managers were scratching their heads. The stock hadn't traded at $1.20 in two months and there was little fresh news around.
